task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 75°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to estimate the height of the building, but I cannot see its top from the current view, so I must look up to see the full structure.
I have looked up 30 degrees, but I still cannot see the top of the building, so I need to tilt my view further upwards to see the entire structure.
I still cannot see the top of the building even after tilting up 30 degrees, so I need to look up even further to get a full view of its height.
My previous attempt to look up did not change my view, so I will try again to tilt my camera upwards to see the top of the building.
My previous attempts to look up further have failed as the pitch remains at 30 degrees; I will try a larger pitch rotation to see the top of the building.
Now that I can see the top of the building at a 45-degree upward pitch, I need to look down to see its base to get a complete view for my height estimation.
I have now seen the top of the building at a +45 degree pitch and the base at a -75 degree pitch; I can now estimate the height based on the total vertical angle and my approximate distance.
